snippet.textDisplay: How about giving people a list of things that they CAN do to help reduce climate change? I've switched lightbulbs to low wattage LED bulbs,  recycle as much as I can,  and am planting more trees where I live. But what else can I do? I've reduced water and power usage as much as I can, only drive when I  must, and yet it seems never to be enough.
snippet.textOriginal: How about giving people a list of things that they CAN do to help reduce climate change? I've switched lightbulbs to low wattage LED bulbs,  recycle as much as I can,  and am planting more trees where I live. But what else can I do? I've reduced water and power usage as much as I can, only drive when I  must, and yet it seems never to be enough.

snippet.textDisplay: My grandma always says “but we had summers hotter than this that lasted months” ok grandma but you don’t remember any of the Cold War or the collapse of segregation despite living through both so you’re not exactly a reliable source. Also trying to explain to you that global warming is global and it’s effects can’t always be seen directly in one location is a nightmare. Ps grandma if summers were soooo different when you were a kid surely that should be a fat old alarm for drastic climate change, it’s not just about global warming it’s also about irregularity in weather patterns and so much more.
snippet.textOriginal: My grandma always says “but we had summers hotter than this that lasted months” ok grandma but you don’t remember any of the Cold War or the collapse of segregation despite living through both so you’re not exactly a reliable source. Also trying to explain to you that global warming is global and it’s effects can’t always be seen directly in one location is a nightmare. Ps grandma if summers were soooo different when you were a kid surely that should be a fat old alarm for drastic climate change, it’s not just about global warming it’s also about irregularity in weather patterns and so much more.

snippet.textDisplay: The truth is, climate change is happening, but there’s no real hope unless you get China, India, SE Asia,  South America, and Africa to not burn gas for the next 50 years. snippet.textDisplay:
The Path to Action: I think people can be made to act if they know what the action is. Scientists, climatologists, Please give us a detailed plan for what an individual, companies, the government should do and how interactions between us should happen with regards to climate change. If we all know what must be done, it is only a matter of time before it is done

edit: Also if there is any possibility we can survive this, it should be made public. Many who know Climate change is real, ignore it, because they believe we can't solve it.
snippet.textOriginal:
The Path to Action: I think people can be made to act if they know what the action is. Scientists, climatologists, Please give us a detailed plan for what an individual, companies, the government should do and how interactions between us should happen with regards to climate change. If we all know what must be done, it is only a matter of time before it is done

edit: Also if there is any possibility we can survive this, it should be made public. Many who know Climate change is real, ignore it, because they believe we can't solve it.

snippet.textDisplay: The biggest issue with "climate change" as it is being argued today is that it is a political argument that use a broad range of logical fallacies and that makes it easy for people to question whether climate disruption is a real thing. Don't believe me?  Go through the way it is currently "argued" using a list of logical fallacies.
snippet.textOriginal: The biggest issue with "climate change" as it is being argued today is that it is a political argument that use a broad range of logical fallacies and that makes it easy for people to question whether climate disruption is a real thing.
